text: Then Moses ascended from the rift valley plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the summit of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho. The Lord showed him the whole land—Gilead to Dan,

and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> of <st data-num="05321" class="">Naphtali</st>, the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> and <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> the <st data-num="0314" class="">distant</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st>,

the <st data-num="05045" class="">Negev</st>, and the <st data-num="03603" class="">plain</st> of the <st data-num="01237" class="">Valley</st> of <st data-num="03405" class="">Jericho</st>, the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> of <st data-num="08558" class="">date palm trees</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> <st data-num="06820" class="">Zoar</st>.
Then the Lord said to him, “This is the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have let you see it, but you will not cross over there.”
So Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there in the land of Moab as the Lord had said.

He<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06912" class="">buried</st> him in the <st data-num="01516" class="">valley</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> <st data-num="04136" class="">near</st> <st data-num="01047" class="">Beth Peor</st>, but <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">knows</st> his exact <st data-num="06900" class="">burial place</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.

<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> was <st data-num="03967 06242">120</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he <st data-num="04194" class="">died</st>, but his <st data-num="05869" class="">eye</st> was <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03543" class="">dull</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> had his <st data-num="03893" class="">vitality</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05127" class="">departed</st>.
The Israelites mourned for Moses in the rift valley plains of Moab for thirty days; then the days of mourning for Moses ended.
Now Joshua son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had placed his hands on him; and the Israelites listened to him and did just what the Lord had commanded Moses.
No prophet ever again arose in Israel like Moses, who knew the Lord face to face.
He did all the signs and wonders the Lord had sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, all his servants, and the whole land,
and he displayed great power and awesome might in view of all Israel.
